Content:
Enable AP settings for this group.
(Default: Disabled)

The maximum amount of action points.
(Default: 6)
This option is disabled if the value equals -1.

The amount of action points gained when a character's turn starts.
(Default: 4)
This option is disabled if the value equals -1.

The starting amount of action points when combat begins.
(Default: 4)
This option is disabled if the value equals -1.

If enabled, two-handed weapons can backstab.
(Default: Disabled)

Enable backstab settings for this group.
(Default: Disabled)

If enabled, only melee weapons or skills can backstab. Melee skills will use the Skill Minimum Distance setting.
(Default: Enabled)

If skill backstabbing is enabled, this is the maximum distance allowed between the attacker and target (meaning they must be within this distance).
(Default: 2.5m)

If enabled, skills will be able to backstab depending on settings (melee only, minimum distance).
(Default: Disabled)

If enabled, characters require the Backstab talent to be able to backstab with non-dagger equipment or skills.
(Default: Enabled)
Clear the status blacklist, which is used to hide statuses next to portraits when <font color='#CCAA00'>[Key:LeaderLib_UI_GameSettings_Client_HideStatuses]</font> is disabled.
Clear the status whitelist, which is used to show statuses next to portraits when <font color='#CCAA00'>[Key:LeaderLib_UI_GameSettings_Client_HideStatuses]</font> is enabled.
Always display the "Scales With x" text that isn't visible if the weapon has an attribute requirement above 0.
If enabled, tooltips that support shift-key expansion will always be expanded.
If enabled, the health and armor bars will always show their values, instead of only on mouse hover.
Try to reduce max item tooltip size by combining elements, such as "On Hit" actions.
Try to reduce max status tooltip size by combining elements, such as immunities.
If enabled, the Divine Talents will always be visible in the player UI, regardless if the gift bag is enabled.
Delay tooltip creation by this amount in seconds. This value will override the usual 0.5 second delay.
Enable a 0.5 second delay for abilities, stats, and talents. May affect the examine window as well.
Enable a 0.5 second delay for generic tooltips (things like button tooltips).
Enable a 0.5 second delay for item tooltips (includes the hotbar).
Enable a 0.5 second delay for skill tooltips.
Enable a 0.5 second delay for status tooltips (statuses next to portraits, and the examine window).

Default: 30%
Fading is disabled at 100 (fully visible), while 0 makes the item completely invisible.
Fade skillbooks that have already been memorized by this amount.[Key:LeaderLib_UI_GameSettings_Client_Fade_DescriptionInfo]

Fade books (recipes, lore) that have already been read by this amount.
Note: This setting isn't retroactive, so previous books read in the save may need to be read again, once.[Key:LeaderLib_UI_GameSettings_Client_Fade_DescriptionInfo]
If enabled, specific items will be less visible in the inventory, such as memorized skillsbooks being less opaque.
Removes the status malus icon and extra spacing, caused by a typo in Larian's UI code, and organizes bonuses and maluses together, while also sorting them alphabetically.
Aggressively prevent the chat log from being visible or toggleable.
If <font color='#33FF66'>Show Consumable Effects</font> is enabled in the global Mod Settings, disable this setting to hide these effects for yourself only.
Show the source of a status, if any, in status tooltips.
Show the mod a status, item, or skill originates from in tooltips.
If enabled, all statuses next to the party's portraits will be hidden.
If enabled, status hiding settings will also apply to statuses under the healthbar when examining a character.
Make the combat log visible initially.
If enabled, tooltips will be forced to stay on the screen, instead of clipping out of bounds.

If enabled, skill memorization requirements will be lowered (such as Necromancy 4 to Necromancy 1).
Ideally enable this alongside Skill Tier Overrides, so more skills can be selected in character creation.
(Default: Disabled)

Various settings that alter how the game works.
These settings can only be changed in singleplayer, or by the host in multiplayer.
Settings are saved to:
Documents/Larian Studios/Divinity Original Sin 2 Definitive Edition/Osiris Data/LeaderLib_GameSettings.json
These settings only affect you. In multiplayer, these settings can be set independently from the host.
These settings affect all players. In multiplayer, only the host can adjust these options.
If enabled, spells can critical hit without the Savage Sortilege talent.

If enabled, Novice/Adept/Master tiered skills will be set to Starter instead, allowing them show up in character creation.
Note that if you don't have the required ability levels for memorization, the skill won't show up (enable Lower Skill Memorization Requirements to avoid that).
(Default: Disabled)
